books.title: Things Fall Apart
books.author: Chinua Achebe
books.description: A story of a man in search of truth told with the simple clarity and beauty of Bunyan’s prose make this the ultimate English classic.

books.author: Hans Christian Andersen
books.title: Fairy tales
books.description: By the end of the 19th century, no book in English literary history had enjoyed more editions, spin-offs and translations. Crusoe’s world-famous novel is a complex literary confection, and it’s irresistible.

books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.description: A satirical masterpiece that’s never been out of print, Jonathan Swift’s Gulliver’s Travels comes third in our list of the best novels written in English

books.author: Jane Austen
books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.description: Clarissa is a tragic heroine, pressured by her unscrupulous nouveau-riche family to marry a wealthy man she detests, in the book that Samuel Johnson described as “the first book in the world for the knowledge it displays of the human heart.”

books.author: Honoré de Balzac
books.title: Le Père Goriot
books.description: Tom Jones is a classic English novel that captures the spirit of its age and whose famous characters have come to represent Augustan society in all its loquacious, turbulent, comic variety.

books.author: Samuel Beckett
books.title: Molloy, Malone Dies, The Unnamable, the trilogy
books.description: Laurence Sterne’s vivid novel caused delight and consternation when it first appeared and has lost little of its original bite.

books.title: The Decameron
books.author: Giovanni Boccaccio
books.description: Jane Austen’s Emma is her masterpiece, mixing the sparkle of her early books with a deep sensibility.

books.author: Jorge Luis Borges
books.title: Ficciones
books.description: Mary Shelley’s first novel has been hailed as a masterpiece of horror and the macabre.

books.author: Emily Brontë
books.title: Wuthering Heights
books.description: The future prime minister displayed flashes of brilliance that equalled the greatest Victorian novelists.

books.author: Albert Camus
books.title: The Stranger
books.description: Emily Brontë’s windswept masterpiece is notable not just for its wild beauty but for its daring reinvention of the novel form itself.

books.author: Paul Celan
books.title: Poems
books.description: William Thackeray’s masterpiece, set in Regency England, is a bravura performance by a writer at the top of his game.

books.author: Louis-Ferdinand Céline
books.title: Journey to the End of the Night
books.description: David Copperfield marked the point at which Dickens became the great entertainer and also laid the foundations for his later, darker masterpieces.

books.author: Miguel de Cervantes
books.title: Don Quijote De La Mancha
books.description: Nathaniel Hawthorne’s astounding book is full of intense symbolism and as haunting as anything by Edgar Allan Poe.

books.author: Geoffrey Chaucer
books.title: The Canterbury Tales
books.description: Wise, funny and gripping, Melville’s epic work continues to cast a long shadow over American literature.

books.author: Anton Chekhov
books.title: Stories
books.description: Lewis Carroll’s brilliant nonsense tale is one of the most influential and best loved in the English canon.

books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.title: Nostromo
books.description: Wilkie Collins’s masterpiece, hailed by many as the greatest English detective novel, is a brilliant marriage of the sensational and the realistic.

books.author: Charles Dickens
books.title: Great Expectations
books.description: Louisa May Alcott’s highly original tale aimed at a young female market has iconic status in America and never been out of print.

books.author: Denis Diderot
books.title: Jacques the Fatalist
books.description: This cathedral of words stands today as perhaps the greatest of the great Victorian fictions.

books.author: Alfred Döblin
books.title: Berlin Alexanderplatz
books.description: Inspired by the author’s fury at the corrupt state of England, and dismissed by critics at the time, The Way We Live Now is recognised as Trollope’s masterpiece.

books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.title: Crime and Punishment
books.description: Mark Twain’s tale of a rebel boy and a runaway slave seeking liberation upon the waters of the Mississippi remains a defining classic of American literature.

books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.title: The Idiot
books.description: A thrilling adventure story, gripping history and fascinating study of the Scottish character, Kidnapped has lost none of its power.

books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.title: The Possessed
books.description: Jerome K Jerome’s accidental classic about messing about on the Thames remains a comic gem.

books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.title: The Brothers Karamazov
books.description: Sherlock Holmes’s second outing sees Conan Doyle’s brilliant sleuth – and his bluff sidekick Watson – come into their own.

books.author: George Eliot
books.title: Middlemarch
books.description: Wilde’s brilliantly allusive moral tale of youth, beauty and corruption was greeted with howls of protest on publication.

books.author: Ralph Ellison
books.title: Invisible Man
books.description: George Gissing’s portrayal of the hard facts of a literary life remains as relevant today as it was in the late 19th century.

books.author: Euripides
books.title: Medea
books.description: Hardy exposed his deepest feelings in this bleak, angry novel and, stung by the hostile response, he never wrote another.

books.author: William Faulkner
books.title: Absalom, Absalom!
books.description: Stephen Crane’s account of a young man’s passage to manhood through soldiery is a blueprint for the great American war novel.

books.author: William Faulkner
books.title: The Sound and the Fury
books.description: Bram Stoker’s classic vampire story was very much of its time but still resonates more than a century later.

books.author: Gustave Flaubert
books.title: Madame Bovary
books.description: Joseph Conrad’s masterpiece about a life-changing journey in search of Mr Kurtz has the simplicity of great myth.

books.author: Gustave Flaubert
books.title: Sentimental Education
books.description: Theodore Dreiser was no stylist, but there’s a terrific momentum to his unflinching novel about a country girl’s American dream.
